column4: does anyone know how to get apt to show the info for the released package it wants to upgrade?  version # etc.
that shows the installed package, not the one it want's to download and install
right, so you take the package name of the package it wants to download and install, and do apt-cache show on that package....
it is an upgrade of a package I have, I want to know what it wants to replace my package with?  I installed from source, it is ffmpeg
if you installed yours from source and it's not in the apt cache, then apt-cache show will show you the one it wants to install

oh, right, I actually made a package and installed it so, when I use apt-cache show ffmpeg it shows me as the maintainer, and shows my package, however now it want's to update it, and I'm quite curious as to what it wants to replace it with.
then download the deb for the package it wants to upgrade and do some dpkg fu on it
I guess I could do that, I was just hoping apt had a way to tell me why it wanted to upgrade it
I guess I could just install it, and then remove it and revert back to my old package, but that is a pain too.
well, i assume you're doing apt-get update.... does it not show a package name with a version there?
The following packages will be upgraded:
I think it is pulling it in as a dep for melt, or something
well the tool is going to either be apt-cache or dpkg, apt-get doesn't do much in the inspection area
right, apt-cache, I will have to look into it more probably as you said, download it and dpkg fu it
ahh, aptitude download ffmpeg gives me the scoop, fyi :)
yeah, i never use aptitude... i should probably consider using it :p
I use it as a fallback when I forget the apt-get commands,
